title: Russia: ZAO Citibank and Alfa Capital Asset Management Sign Partnership Agreement
summary: Moscow - ZAO Citibank and Alfa Capital Asset Management have signed an agreement that allows the investment products of Alfa Capital Asset Management to be offered to clients at Citibank branches across Russia.
tag-1: Russia: ZAO Citibank and Alfa Capital Asset Management Sign Partnership Agreement
tag-3: Moscow – ZAO Citibank and Alfa Capital Asset Management have signed an agreement that allows the investment products of Alfa Capital Asset Management to be offered to clients at Citibank branches across Russia.
tag-4: Under this agreement, Citibank clients will be able to invest in four mutual funds managed by Alfa Capital Asset Management: Alfa Capital Bonds Plus, Alfa Capital Oil & Gas, Alfa Capital High Tech and Alfa Capital Consumer Sector. Clients can choose the strategy which suits them best and acquire units in these funds at 48 Citibank offices in eight cities across Russia: Moscow, St. Petersburg, Samara, Rostov-on-Don, Yekaterinburg, Nizhniy Novgorod, Volgograd and Ufa.
tag-5: "The development strategy for Alfa Capital's retail business includes the expansion of partnerships with the leading commercial banks. We have a proactive approach to the development of our retail business and the promotion of funds which are likely to be attractive to potential clients. Today it is commonplace in international practice to attract higher volumes of investment through partner banks than via one's own sales network. According to certain studies, more than 40 percent of all investment flows into international funds and is originated through agent banks. We anticipate that in the near future Citibank will become one of our strategic partners. Citibank's years of experience in the investment market, high level of professionalism and qualified personnel give us good reason to expect very impressive results from our cooperation. Through this partnership program we are offering our best investment strategies, which have received professional awards1 and have clear competitive advantages," noted Irina Krivosheeva, CEO of Alfa Capital Asset Management.
tag-6: "We are pleased to offer our clients another opportunity to strengthen and diversify their investment portfolios," said Sergey Korotkov, Retail Banking Business Head at Citibank. "Alfa Capital Asset Management, one of the pioneers in the Russian asset management market, today offers high-quality products and is focused on providing world-class client service. Mutual funds remain a very relevant collective investment product in Russia, and this market is actively developing. We are confident that our clients will appreciate the advantages provided by our new partner."
tag-7: Investors can purchase, exchange or cash out units of the abovementioned mutual funds, submit changes to one's personal file in the register of mutual fund unit owners and carry out other actions as permitted by law. Additionally, a Citibank consultant can provide recommendations to clients on the formation of a personal portfolio model and/or diversification of one's existing portfolio based on the client's risk profile and with guidance from the analytical reports of the bank's stock and bonds specialists.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-9: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-10: ZAO Citibank was one of the first banks with foreign capital to enter the Russian market back in 1992. Today, Citibank is one of the country's largest banks, which offers corporate and private clients a wide range of products and services. To date, the bank has over 4,000 employees, and its retail network includes over 550 ATMs, branches and representative offices in major cities of Russia, Kazakhstan and Ukraine. For more information on Citibank Russia please visit www.citibank.ru.
tag-11: Alfa Capital Asset Management is one of the largest companies on the Russian asset management market. Alfa Capital was established in 1996 and is a pioneer in the management of the assets of private, institutional and corporate investors. Alfa Capital is part of Alfa Group, one of Russia's largest privately owned financial-industry conglomerates. Net assets under management total over 87 billion rubles.2
